meanings.definition: A currently circulating story or report of uncertain or doubtful truth.
meanings.sent1: The rumours about the new student were not true.
meanings.sent2: She heard rumours about a surprise party for her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The rumours of a talking dog in the neighborhood made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rumours of a ghost haunting the old house sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The rumours of buried treasure in the backyard captured their imagination.

meanings.sent1: The office was buzzing with rumours about the upcoming promotion.
meanings.sent2: She didn't pay attention to the hurtful rumours spread about her.
meanings.sent3: The rumours about the alien invasion were the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The rumours of a secret affair between the two celebrities spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The juicy rumours about the scandal kept everyone hooked.
